transcript: if you were to hack into my iPhone and see my news feed you'd find out that ninety percent of what I consume it's either comedy or philosophy and it's because they share one common trait they're both true one of the things that's interesting about philosophers is that they State truths in platitudes that are Eternal which is why I like them because they become pillars of how we can see the world but what's interesting is that comedians also say things that are true but they're true contextually they say common things that are obvious but people don't take the time to observe I love the juxtaposition of both those things which is one is contextual truths the others are Eternal truths those are the things that I drive the most Joy from and I think it's because they continue to shift my perspective on my own reality
